author: 三星傳媒
title: 丹娜絲颱風來襲 造成嘉義縣市災情嚴重 嘉邑行善團助災區
text:
(記者黃音文／嘉義報導)中度颱風"丹娜絲"來襲，造成嘉義市、嘉義縣全境災情嚴重，尤其嘉義縣多個鄉鎮市無電無水，嘉邑行善團鄭秀玉理事長立即啟動救災活動，除了捐助嘉義市政府及嘉義縣政府各新台幣1000萬元協助災害救助外，鄭秀玉理事長及執行長蔡坤章及團隊前往水上鄉、中埔鄉、鹿草鄉、義竹鄉、竹崎鄉等發送便當及粽子，此善行義舉獲災區民眾好評。
嘉邑行善團鄭秀玉理事長(左2)帶領團隊至義竹鄉發送便當及粽子，由黃政傑鄉長(左3)代表接受並感謝愛心善舉。(圖/記者黃音文翻攝)
鄭秀玉理事長代表捐助新台幣1000萬元協助嘉義縣政府災害救助，由縣長翁章梁代表接受，也嘉義市捐助新台幣1000萬元協助嘉義市政府災害救助，獲得市長黃敏惠及縣長翁章梁感謝該團愛心善舉。
嘉邑行善團執行長蔡坤章(左1)及團隊前往水上鄉發送粽子由水上鄉長林緗亭(左5)代為受贈。(圖/記者黃音文翻攝)
丹娜絲颱風重創嘉義之後，因停電造成多地民眾生活不便，無法正常開伙餐。嘉邑行善團執行長蔡坤章及理監事除了中埔鄉，竹崎灣橋村發送便當外，因嘉義縣有多個鄉鎮仍處於停電中，以及有鄉長向該團尋求支援。因此鄭理事長馬上安排數位理監事繼續前往鹿草鄉,義竹鄉及水上鄉等地方發送便當及粽子。
嘉邑行善團執行長蔡坤章(右5)及團隊前往中埔鄉發送便當由中埔鄉長李碧雲(左6)代為受贈。(圖/記者黃音文翻攝)
發送過程中也非常感謝中埔鄉李碧雲鄉長,鹿草鄉嚴珮瑜鄉長,義竹鄉黃政傑鄉長及竹崎灣橋村洪安定村長等協助組織人手幫忙送到的便當及粽子馬上發送到民眾家裡。
嘉邑行善團執行長蔡坤章(右2)及團隊前往鹿草鄉發送便當由鹿草鄉長嚴珮瑜(左2)代為受贈。(圖/記者黃音文翻攝)

author: ChadMendez
title: #30 Belén "blasfemo" con personas del mismo sexo indigna a los conservadores italianos
text:
[gelatti](/user/gelatti)a [es.investing.com](/go/link/3890231)
Puedo entender que les moleste por "romper la tradición" a mi también me molesta cuando le quitan la barba a un personaje de comic que la lleva.
Ahora, que les moleste porque sea del mismo sexo,,, recordemos que a esta mujer le preño una paloma y vamos a tirarnos ahora de los pelos porque esté con una mujer?
[#4](c4#c-4) Eso explicaría de forma que todo el mundo pueda entender como María llegó virgen a su cita con la paloma pese a estar casada.
[#4](c4#c-4) mira que podía haber optado por convertir a los reyes en gays, o hacer una carroza del orgullo con los pastorcillos, pero poner dos vírgenes María es un sinsentido. Respeta lo básico del Belén y a partir de ahí añade lo que quieras, no te pases tomando licencias que luego queda irreconocible.
[#18](c18#c-18) pues está dentro de la tradición. Si en el belén había un buey, ¿por qué no unas boyeras?
Dicho con todo el respeto hacia las lesbianas y el resto de personas que solo quieren ejercer su libertad sexual sin que venga ningún cura a meter el hocico.
[#2](c2#c-2) Ojalá algún día se pueda extraer energía de la subnormalidad y la estupidez. Conquistariamos el universo.
[#24](c24#c-24) pero es que quizás no es cuestión de comprensión lectora, si no de capacidad redactora.
O quizás será bueno que en vez de dar una vuelta a las cosas dijeras claramente lo que quieres decír.
A mi que vengas con rodeos sobre que si el islam se debe enseñar por que la otra se enseña, pero eh, que a mi no me gusta... Me dice que no sabes ni lo que hablas.
A mi me la pela. Esta bien lo de defender la libertad de expresión y la libertad para creer o no creer.
Tus creencias para ti y yo en un país libre haré lo que quiera.
Pero luego vemos la otra cara de la moneda.
Que si una diputada de podemos dice que el islam es el feminismo e invento la seguridad social.
https://www.google.com/amp/s/amp.antena3.com/noticias/espana/polemicas-declaraciones-nora-banos-candidata-podemos-islam-feminista-invento-seguridad-social_202002245e53d5a00cf2a8ef178bab57.html
Público, el periódico que izquierdas llamando la atención por que no se enseña suficiente islam en las escuelas.
https://www.google.com/amp/s/www.publico.es/sociedad/asignatura-religion-islamica-colegios-espana-alumnos-musulmanes.html/amp
Se puede reivindicar con el belen, pero hay que retirar cerdo para no ofender a los musulmanes.
https://www.google.com/amp/s/www.elespanol.com/espana/20230626/cup-exige-retirar-alimentos-cerdo-fiestas-cataluna-respeto-musulmanes/774422768_0.amp.html
Muy buena esta libertad.
[#12](c12#c-12) Lo que tú no entiendes es que si metes en el juego las creencias de unos no puedes sacar las de otros. Y para que no se ofendan los capillitas somos capaces de comer por todos lados. Yo estoy COMPLETAMENTE EN CONTRA de que haya CUALQUIER religión en educación, sanidad o en el ejercicio, pero por otro lado, entiendo que si esta presente una, los demás pidan lo propio.
Se nos olvida que la iglesia se lleva un buen pico por dar "ese servicio" no solo en colegios
[#17](c17#c-17) tu comentario esta mal desarrollado y carece de sentido.
Estas "COMPLETAMENTE EN CONTRA de que haya CUALQUIER religión en educación, sanidad o en el ejército " pero por otro lado "entiendo que si esta presente una, los demás pidan lo propio."
No ves falta de lógica en tu argumento? Estas en contra y al mismo tiempo a favor.
[#19](c19#c-19) No, estoy encontra de que paguemos el profe de religión en los coles, el mantenimiento de capilla en universidades, hospitales y cuarteles (con su correspondiente cura). Y hablamos de religión catolica.
Ahora bien, ENTIENDO, que si hay prevendas para unos, los otros (llamese musulmanes, testigos de Jehova o san pitopato), estén en su derecho de recibir las mismas.
No tienes ningún tipo de comprensión lectora.
[#20](c20#c-20) ahora ya te voy entendiendo mejor.
Básicamente, ahora lo que me dices es que no al catolicismo, pero como esta el catolicismo, entonces las demás también.
Podrías haber dicho, quitemos el catolicismo y no dejemos pasar el resto de religiones, pero.... Si hay una todas las demás también. Y sin embargo dices que estás en contra.
Lo lógico sería decir que estás en contra del catolicismo y a favor de toda las demás.
Que no se enteren los de vox que en el Belén de Vilavenut también hay dos madres haciendo de Maria y José.
https://www.ccma.cat/324/el-pessebre-vivent-de-vilavenut-enguany-amb-dues-mares-de-deu-i-sense-sant-josep/noticia/3268061/

author: Enviroliteracy Team
title: Why does my hot water smell like rotten eggs after vacation?
text:
Why Does My Hot Water Smell Like Rotten Eggs After Vacation? The dreaded rotten egg smell emanating from your hot water tap after returning from vacation is a common and unpleasant experience. The primary culprit is hydrogen sulfide (H2S) gas , a byproduct of sulfur bacteria flourishing in your hot water system while it’s been idle. When you turn on the tap, this gas is released, resulting in that distinctive and unwelcome odor. Several factors contribute to this perfect storm, including the presence of sulfate-reducing bacteria (SRB) , the design of your water heater, and the chemistry of your water supply.
The Science Behind the Stink Let’s delve a bit deeper into the science behind the “rotten egg” odor. Sulfur bacteria are anaerobic microorganisms, meaning they thrive in environments lacking oxygen. They feed on sulfates, which are naturally present in many water sources. Your hot water heater, especially when left unused, provides an ideal breeding ground. Here’s a breakdown of how it happens:
Sulfate Source : Sulfates are dissolved minerals that exist naturally in water. Anaerobic Conditions : When your water heater sits unused, oxygen levels deplete, creating a haven for anaerobic bacteria. Bacterial Activity : Sulfate-reducing bacteria break down the sulfates. Hydrogen Sulfide Production : The bacteria convert the sulfates into hydrogen sulfide gas. Odor Release : When you turn on the hot water tap, the dissolved hydrogen sulfide gas is released, producing the rotten egg smell. The Anode Rod Connection The anode rod inside your water heater is designed to protect the tank from corrosion. This rod, typically made of magnesium or aluminum , sacrifices itself to electrochemical corrosion, preserving the tank’s integrity. However, this process can indirectly contribute to the problem.
Sulfate Reaction : The rod’s interaction with sulfates in the water can encourage the growth of sulfur bacteria. Hydrogen Sulfide Production : Some anode rods can break down sulfates in the water into hydrogen sulfide gas. Rod Type Impact : Magnesium rods, in particular, are often associated with increased hydrogen sulfide production compared to aluminum rods. Well Water Woes If you rely on well water , you might be even more susceptible to the rotten egg smell. Well water is more likely to contain higher concentrations of naturally occurring sulfates and dissolved minerals.
Natural Occurrence : Hydrogen sulfide can naturally occur in wells due to decay and chemical reactions with soil and rocks. Contamination Concerns : Runoff and geological formations can introduce sulfates into your well water supply. Well Maintenance : Regular well maintenance, including shocking with chlorine, is essential to combat bacteria. Solutions to the Stinky Situation Fortunately, you don’t have to live with the offensive odor forever. Here are several effective solutions:
Flush the Water Heater : This is the first line of defense. Drain the water heater completely to remove accumulated sediment and bacteria. It can be done by attaching a hose to the drain valve located near the bottom of the tank. Open the valve and let all of the water drain out. Chlorine Bleach Treatment : Add chlorine bleach to the tank to kill the sulfur bacteria. This is a common practice: Turn off the water heater and carefully remove the anode rod. Mix a solution of chlorine bleach (follow the manufacturer’s directions for concentration, generally about 1/4 cup per 10 gallons of tank capacity) and pour it directly into the tank. Let the solution sit for several hours (2-4 hours). Flush the tank thoroughly until the chlorine smell is gone. Reinstall the anode rod (or replace it). Increase Water Heater Temperature : Raising the water temperature to 160°F (71°C) for several hours can kill off the bacteria. Be sure to exercise caution to prevent scalding. Anode Rod Replacement : Consider replacing the magnesium anode rod with an aluminum rod. It’s a practical step. Water Softener or Chlorinator : A water softener can reduce sulfate levels in your water. A chlorinator injects chlorine continuously, preventing bacterial growth. Activated Carbon Filter : An activated carbon filter can effectively remove hydrogen sulfide gas from your water. It will also improve the taste of your water. Shock Chlorination (Well Water) : For well water, shock chlorination involves introducing a high concentration of chlorine into the well to disinfect it. Professional Plumbing Assistance : If the problem persists, consult a qualified plumber. A plumber can professionally flush your system. Hydrogen Peroxide Treatment (Well Water) : You can shock your well with chlorine bleach or hydrogen peroxide. Chlorine Injector System (Well Water) : For continuous injection of chlorine when the water is running. Ultraviolet Sterilizer : An ultraviolet sterilizer can help eliminate the bacteria responsible of sulfur smell. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) 1. Is it safe to drink water that smells like rotten eggs? In low concentrations, sulfur in water isn’t typically a health hazard. However, high sulfate levels can cause diarrhea . Most people find the taste unpleasant regardless.
2. Should I call a plumber if my water smells like rotten eggs? If the problem persists after trying DIY solutions, calling a plumber is advisable. A plumber can help to flush and clean your hot water tank.
3. Can hydrogen sulfide in water make you sick? While usually not a health risk at concentrations in household water, hydrogen sulfide is flammable and poisonous at high concentrations. Exposure to elevated concentrations of hydrogen sulfide can lead to dizziness and headaches.
4. Is it safe to shower in water that smells like sulfur? Showering in water that smells like sulfur is generally considered safe. However, prolonged exposure to elevated levels of hydrogen sulfide gas in the air can be irritating.
5. Will shocking my well get rid of the sulfur smell? Yes, shock chlorination is effective for temporary relief. However, the bacteria often return, necessitating repeat treatments.
6. Why does my hot water smell like rotten eggs, but not my cold water? The “rotten egg” odor that is isolated to your hot water supply is the result of a chemical reaction in your water heater.
7. Why does my hot water smell like rotten eggs in my camper? This smell is typically caused by anaerobic bacteria reacting with magnesium or aluminum anode rods in your RV’s water heater, resulting in the release of hydrogen sulfide gas.
8. Why does only one faucet smell like rotten eggs? The issue may be localized to the specific faucet or plumbing line, potentially due to sulfur bacteria growth or organic matter breakdown in that section of the system.
9. Why does my house smell weird after vacation? The stagnation of air and buildup of normal household odors, which you’ve become accustomed to, become noticeable after an absence.
10. Why does my hot water stink, but not the cold? This indicates the source of the odor is likely within the water heater itself, where bacteria thrive in the warm, stagnant environment.
11. Why does my hot water smell all of a sudden? Often, the smell originates from a magnesium heating rod in the hot water tank.
12. Will draining my hot water heater help with the sulfur smell? Draining helps remove sediment, but it doesn’t eliminate the bacteria. Combining draining with bleach treatment is more effective.
13. Will a water softener remove the sulfur smell? Ordinary household water softeners do not remove sulfur odors from water.
14. When I turn on the shower, it smells like rotten eggs; why? This can be caused by the buildup of biofilm and bacteria in the shower drain, which breaks down organic matter and releases hydrogen sulfide gas.
15. Where can I learn more about water quality and environmental issues? The Environmental Literacy Council , at enviroliteracy.org , offers valuable resources on environmental science and water quality.
